message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about changes that can occur on Earth. Option (A) is incorrect because the sands of Mars moving would not be classified as a change on Earth. Option (B) is incorrect because the moon appearing larger in the night sky is an optical illusion and not a physical change on Earth. Option (D) is incorrect because a skyscraper being built is a human-made change and not a natural change on Earth. Option (C) is the correct answer because a volcano erupting in Hawaii and burning through a forest is an example of a natural change on Earth.

This question requires some basic knowledge about changes that occur on Earth. Option (C) is the correct answer because a volcano erupting in Hawaii and burning through a forest represents a change in the Earth's physical landscape due to geological activity. Options (A) and (B) are incorrect because they are referring to changes that occur on other celestial bodies, not the Earth. Option (D) is also incorrect because the construction of a skyscraper is a human-made change, not a natural change in the Earth itself.
